item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, May 20, 2025 at 1:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. A simple search engine from scratch (99 points | 5 comments)
2. The emoji problem (2022) (138 points | 14 comments)
3. Making Video Games (Without an Engine) in 2025 (281 points | 104 comments)
4. Show HN: Text to 3D simulation on a map (does history pretty well) (10 points | 6 comments)
5. DDoSecrets publishes 410 GB of heap dumps, hacked from TeleMessage (512 points | 137 comments)
6. Have I Been Pwned 2.0 (676 points | 208 comments)
7. Poll: How often do you bathe? (6 points | 2 comments)
8. Firewalls and BIOS's and Coreboot (2020) (5 points | 1 comment)
9. Reports of Deno's Demise Have Been Greatly Exaggerated (82 points | 73 comments)
10. Show HN: JavaFactory – IntelliJ plugin to generate Java code (15 points | 1 comment)
11. Finland announces migration of its rail network to international gauge (283 points | 246 comments)
12. Jules: An Asynchronous Coding Agent (397 points | 157 comments)
13. GitHub Copilot Coding Agent (485 points | 307 comments)
14. What are people doing? Live-ish estimates based on global population dynamics (187 points | 77 comments)
15. Why Does the U.S. Always Run a Trade Deficit? (45 points | 72 comments)
16. The Windows Subsystem for Linux is now open source (1416 points | 957 comments)
17. The behavior of LLMs in hiring decisions: Systemic biases in candidate selection (116 points | 91 comments)
18. I got fooled by AI-for-science hype–here's what it taught me (227 points | 171 comments)
19. Questioning Representational Optimism in Deep Learning (31 points | 2 comments)
20. Claude Code SDK (384 points | 167 comments)
21. Launch HN: Better Auth (YC X25) – Authentication Framework for TypeScript (224 points | 83 comments)
22. Kilo: A text editor in less than 1000 LOC with syntax highlight and search (176 points | 33 comments)
23. Linguists Find Proof of Sweeping Language Pattern Once Deemed a 'Hoax' (17 points | 10 comments)
24. Run GitHub Actions locally (255 points | 108 comments)
25. Imagine a drive where every file exists as all file types all of the time (10 points | 18 comments)
26. Biff – a batteries-included web framework for Clojure (64 points | 18 comments)
27. Compiling OCaml to the TI-84 CE Calculator (9 points | discuss)
28. Game theory illustrated by an animated cartoon game (333 points | 53 comments)
29. Ann, the Small Annotation Server (61 points | 10 comments)
30. A man who visited every country in the world without boarding a plane (2023) (81 points | 40 comments)
